title: The London Eye went in reverse for the first time on Friday. Find out why
text:
USA TODAY

The Coca-Cola London Eye – the fancy Ferris wheel you take to score stunning views of London – reversed and went in the opposite direction for the first time Friday morning to mark the end of British Summer Time.

British Summer Time, which entails turning clocks back an hour toward the end of October, has been around for 47 years. The London Eye, in turn, rotated the opposite direction for an hour.

"This year we wanted to mark the end of British Summer Time with an all-time first experience, rotating the London Eye in reverse to showcase the iconic view from a new perspective," Sunny Jouhal, general Manager at the London Eye, said in a statement.

Those on board the London Eye for this spin, which featured a light show, won their spots in a competition. The London Eye's Instagram account featured the experience as part of its Stories.

"Had a fun time @TheLondonEye this morning," Laura Tobin of "Good Morning Britain" wrote on Twitter. "For the first time EVER the wheel went backwards for 1 hour to remind everyone that the clocks go BACK 1 hour on Sunday."

A can't-miss-it tourist attraction, the London Eye has been a fixture in London for almost 20 years. Tickets vary in price; tourists can save money by purchasing tickets ahead of time online.
description: The Coca-Cola London Eye reversed and went in the opposite direction for the first time Friday morning to mark the end of British Summer Time.
